sv:property.sv:value:
Umpires run across the field trying to keep up with you. Your fingers frantically dig into the soil as you climb the Tuzzaġuq hill to the base of the square purple stone that holds the Sword. An umpire sounds a horn as you lift the Sword clear above your head. The crowd applauds wildly as your challengers collapse on the ground, exhausted. YOU are the Chieftain of the Eqrigin.

 

The Eqrigin national dish is the Mnażżas. Mnażżas consists of maize fried with copious amounts of purple spices. This mainstay is enjoyed several times a week and several jokes are made reagrding the effects of this diet on their feces.

Your people consume 50% more Corn and 50% more Spices.

 

The Eqrigin respect wealth. Also, they like to show off their wealth so that it is clear to all who are their betters. Golden crowns adorned with purple gems, rings and braclets the Eqrigin are always well adourned. The richest among the Eqrigin sparkle from head to toe and are positively weighed down with decoration.

Your people consume 50% more Jewelry and 50% more Gems.

 

On Mondays the Eqrigin all wear their traditional Ċuwġuw. On Tuesday, you will see them wearing their blue Bażguggoċs. In fact, the Eqrigin have a uniform for every day of the week. Every special occasion, comes with a special dress code. Eqrigin wardrobes are always full to bursting and their tailors are always busy.

Your people consume 75% more Clothes.

 

Guide your people to prosperity. Go forth into the world.
Welcome, Atalaster. Leader of the Eqrigin.

Umpires run across the field trying to keep up with you. Your fingers frantically dig into the soil as you climb the Asporous hill to the base of the square grey stone that holds the Sword. An umpire sounds a horn as you lift the Sword clear above your head. The crowd applauds wildly as your challengers collapse on the ground, exhausted. YOU are the Grand Vizier of the Descendants of Spolous.

 

The Descendants of Spolous believe strongly in the difference between human food and animal feed. The distinction is rather arbitrary, as unprocessed grains like rice or maize are considered to be fodder and not suitable for human consumption. Eating such foods is considered to be foreign, odd or a mark of desperate poverty.

Your people consume 50% less Rice and 50% less Corn.

 

The Descendants of Spolous are not famous for their food. Or rather, they are famous for having terribly bland and uninspiring food. Boiling and steaming are the preferred methods of cooking and Descendants of Spolous palates are known to be sensitive to spicy food prefering more watery, earthy tastes. It is said by foreigners that in the lands of the Descendants of Spolous good food can be found, as long as it is foreign.

Your people consume 50% less Salt and 75% less Spices.

 

Some call the Descendants of Spolous shameless. The truth however is that they are just very comfortable in their skin. Though shocking to foreign visitors, the Descendants of Spolous prance around completely naked when indoors. They do this outdoors too, as long as the weather permits it. They consider clothes to be an unwelcome burden and unnecessary expense. 

Your people consume 75% less Clothes and 50% less Silk.

 

Guide your people to prosperity. Go forth into the world.
Welcome, Atalaster. Leader of the Descendants of Spolous.
